section.title: Preface
section.para: This manual documents the Naked Objects Framework, the development of Naked Objects applications, and the development of its associated components and tools. The is both a reference guide for application developers and for developers of the components. For an introduction to Naked Objects and the the ideas behind the framework please refer to the book Naked Objects (by Richard Pawson and Robert Matthews) published by Wiley.
This manual is currently available as a PDF document, to be viewed using Adobe Acrobat, and online via a browser.

This edition of the manual is intended for use with version 2.0 of the Naked Objects framework, which works with version 1.1, and higher, of Java and version 1.1 of .Net. The latest framework is available from the download's page of the naked objects website .

Naked Objects is free software, this means that everyone is free to use, and free to redistribute it on certain conditions. Naked Objects is copyrighted software and has restrictions placed on its distribution, but as set out by Free Software Foundation these are intended to encourage sharing rather than preventing it.
The simplest way to get hold of a copy of Naked Objects is to download it from the naked object website: , or to get a copy from a colleague or friend.

I would like to acknowledge the contributions that Dan Haywood has made toward the development of the framework, and would like to also thank all those at the DSFA and Bearing Point for their questions, comments and suggestions.
